response.original_title: The Secret Group That Planned an Insurrection Against Slavery
response.overview: "Moses Dickson, a traveling barber in the years before the Civil War, had a secretâ€“ he was one of twelve members of a covert society that planned to recruit men who were 'courageous, patient, temperate, and possessed of sound common sense.' Their goal? Launch a coordinated insurrection against slaveholders and claim land for black people in the South. And they almost did."
response.title: The Secret Group That Planned an Insurrection Against Slavery
